intro: Pycnandra filipes subsp. multiflora, commonly known as the yellow-flowered pycnandra, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a shrub, with simple, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is adapted to moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological significance in its native habitat.
